nodes.bodyText:
https://www.jenkins.io/doc/pipeline/steps/workflow-basic-steps/#error-error-signal
sais error aborts the build and avoids printing the stack trace. But since you are printing the error message anyway, why not sticking with the one-liner throw?

The reason of the change is all explained in the commit message.
The echo here is for debugging purpose, to output the custom message that we're building.
The error will then be thrown and catched by the surrounding try/catch block: https://github.com/nuxeo/nuxeo/blob/fix-NXP-29596-fail-PR-build-on-dev-unit-tests-failure/ci/Jenkinsfiles/build.groovy#L540, that might decide to continue or to rethrow, in which case the error message will be finally printed at the end of the build logs.
Ok I get it. So this echo will be done as long as we catch and if in dev environment, the message will be printed at the end of the logs to facilitate seeing  it

If not on a PR and in dev yes.
The error is then simply propagated as for any kind of failure, so the pipeline will naturally make the build fail and display the error message at the end of the logs.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            Waiting for NXP-29512, on a PR, the build continues even if there is a unit test error in other
          
          
            
                            environments than the dev one.
          
          
            
                            While waiting for NXP-29512 to be resolved, the build in non-dev environment continues even if there are unit test error.

on a PR

Cannot remove this, it's representative, look at the actual test in the if.
For the the beginning of the sentence, not sure about the added value: suggestion is longer, we try to keep things short.
For the end, it is not that clear: "the build in non-dev environment continues" suggests that only the build that would take place in the dev environment (so the "dev unit tests stage"?) would continue. In fact, we're talking about the whole build.
